title: Yes, Hecarim and Mundo need nerfs
body:
No, pointing out things in Yasuo or Lee Sin's kits does not change the fact that Mundo and Hecarim need nerfs

Yes, Lee Sin and Yasuo can be problems in addition to Mundo and Hecarim

No, Mundo and Hecarim are not the only champions that need nerfs

Yes, Lee Sin has been a top competitive pick for awhile

No, endlessly circlejerking about this and downvoting my posts in this thread don't change the fact that Hecarim and Mundo need to be toned down

Have a nice day

replies.body: Mundo, possibly, but Hecarim is actually in a fairly solid place right now. He is slightly strong, but not a big enough outlier to warrant attention over more egregious champions.

Removing the ignore unit collision from Hecarim is definitely something, that will hurt as the creep block is unbearable.

What Sophita said, plus, why should Hecarim be able to avoid unit collision? Honestly I feel It's a change that just makes sense. One of the things about playing large champions is that they have less maneuverability than small ones around things, and Hecarim is fucking huge. Minions shouldn't just be ignored all the time, they are a core part of the game after all.

Have you looked at his kit? Hecarim's identity and the flow of his kit rely on his mobility. It's sad to see that go even though I , personally, would not be too affected by it because I only play Hecarim jungle.

Yes small champions are nimble and large ones tend to be less maneuverable 
but Hecarims identity is the stampeding war pony that tramples all in his path.

Stomping over minions made sense. 

I would have prefered seeing a nerf somewhere else

If it beats Jax, it must be OP.

Of course I never hear you call for Rageblade nerfs or for the recognition that Jax has gotten nothing but direct and indirect buffs to both his lane and jungle. And for what? For getting the exact same base stat nerfs that Hecarim is getting which, as you said, gutted Jax.

Nice Ad hominem

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/NwP6Raih-rageblade-needs-a-nerf-i-dont-think-anyone-can-deny-it-at-this-point

If you noticed, Riot is tackling all those things at once next patch in some form

Nice try though
lmao 300 gold... Rageblade went from 200% gold efficient to merely 180% gold efficient. I'm sure it will make a huge difference, almost as big as 3 AD on Vayne or 20 mana on Brand. hahahahaha

The 3 AD nerf actually hit Vayne pretty damn hard. If it takes like 10 auto's (example) for vayne to kill you, and every auto does 75 she will deal 750 AD damage (not including armor mitigation). Post nerf, every auto now deals 72, and she will deal 720 damage. Her target will now live with 30 HP. 

Now think of how many times that you've survived with under 50 HP. 

Exactly.
You underestimate how big of a nerf -3 ad actually did to Vayne.

You're literally handing her a gun in Medieval Europe. She's going to run off and wreck shit because that's what you do in that situation. 3 AD actually hurts her a bit, as did the loss of base true damage. However, everything else is lined up in her favor because Rito balance. She wouldn't be so crazy if the stars didn't align for her this time.

Of course some champions causing problems doesn't make other champions being too strong O.K.

However, it does strike me as odd that they would address these two first. Perhaps it's because the solution is simply more straight-forward, but I can't really speak for Riot.

I am more of a nerf Vayne and Ahri circle jerker. But the Hecarim hp nerfs are not needed, if they go through with the deadmans nerf along with the HP nerfs he will have 200 HP less which is very big.

Honestly, if they wanted to nerf hecarim's lane, they could have just nerfed or even removed the healing he gets off of non monster minions.

Or they could have made it so that hitting regular minions doesn't reduce the cooldown of his q, so he actually has to commit to a fight to spam it.

But instead they nerf his lategame, which is one of the things he was best known for, and they remove his passive, which gave him his niche in toplane.

And there are no compensation buffs in sight.

100% agree,  except i would go further and say that his passive is most of the reason why half the players bought him. its exceptionally thematic and and functional and has a noticeable feel-good effect. unlike its counterparts on kassadin and fizz. what good is his q without his passive? its a mere farm tool without it. replacing the attack move for q's were what really made him stick after combos. now we are supposed to attack move?

If this mana nerf is significant enough it'll force him into starting Morellonomicon, which will delay his spike by a whole 2550 gold. That's a big deal.

Actually it is more because tanks now have their base armor untouched by LW items. having that 86 base armor always there compared to it being reduced by 35% before 5.22 making it 51.84 dues have an impact.

Add in the weaker BotRK, masteries and you have some potential problems that might arise.

Still doesn't change people not buying an 800g item that renders self-sustainers useless, I know it's gimped but it's still better than nothing....

Had a mundo getting fed  4 kills so i figured as soon as lane phase is over im rushing executioner blade, mundo was simple to deal with allowing us to actually fight. I actually like that riot is only nerfing his early game and leaving his late game intact cause executioner does counter him but noone wants to buy it early.

IF you think it makes them useless then you are a fool.

It is suppose to be a reasonable counter not a be all end all of self healers that makes them useless.

>Yes, Lee Sin has been a top competitive pick for awhile

Outside of LCS though, Lee was considered a second or even third tier jungler this past season.  Now Riot gives him a useless ult buff and a decent passive buff to get him back into favor and people freak out as if he never left God tier.

People don't freak out because he was buffed to get back into favor. People freak out because, of all champions who actually need help, some of which got overnerfed specifically because they were in favor for a while, buffs (and unneeded ones at that) go to the one who never leaves the spotlight, has incredibly frustrating kit to play against and constantly sports one of highest pickrates in game.
Seriously, anyone not playing Lee is sick of him after years of constantly seeing him both in esports and their own games. And when next to people like Aatrox who are kept in the trash can for long Lee gets buff after few patches of not being number one pick of course people will get pissed off.

Hecarim is always bullshit. He receives love-taps and everyone screams "HE WAS GUTTED" then flies under the radar for another 6 months.

Mundo is a consequence of many buffs over several patches and then BotKR nerfs. Mortal Reminder does virtually jackshit to him, sorry guys. I built it, he still recovered full HP from being almost dead.

But while we're "trimming excess power" from Hecarim's kit (lol), and seeing Lee Sin being mentioned in this thread, can we remove the stun from the start AND the end of Dragon's Rage?

Why does it matter that he has it? It's just there to keep his aim from being extremely awkward on the kick. It's an extremely short stun. 

I like how nobody cared or knew about this stun, but as soon as it's brought up it suddenly has to be removed, like that'd be the silver bullet. The stun is there for a bit of QoL for Lee, with very little actual practical usage other than making it so his kick isn't horribly awkward to use.

Hit shit on Lee that actually needs to be hit, not QoL stuff on him.

Because you're inable to use your CC back at him at the start. And then he lands the easiest Q after because you're still stuck there after the animation.

Honestly, Lee isn't even that bad to play against in Plat. He's popular but everyone knows how to play around him

If Mundo recovered to full from nearly dead then something has gone wrong, such as you not auto attacking him or something.  With Grievous wounds on him he won't heal for even half his hp from his ult.  Mortal Reminder cuts his health gain over 8 seconds from 58% (Undying grasp, ult, passive, spirit visage) to 35% of max HP.  If he had 4000 max HP that is a difference of 900 HP which is quite a bit.

Mortal Reminder does quite a bit to Mundo but he will still be hard to kill (and will still need some nerfs).

I was Vayne.

I autoed him to 15% health

He ulted, with GW on him.

He ran around the fight with Spirit Visage and Warmogs and got back up to full.

Mortal Reminder does not do enough when it's only cutting his healing by 40%.

And the worst part is, he still did damage thanks to his E and Q % HP scaling. He was a massive damage threat and damage sponge. You could not ignore him but if you focussed him, you're wasting your time.

Warmogs kicks in at 8 seconds after damage, that means that you or your teammates didn't hit him for that 8+ seconds. Yes, Mundo is a bit strong right now, but the fact of the matter is, you and your team failed to keep Reminder's debuff on him once he hit ult. Even if Warmogs heart didn't kick in, it's still on you. As a Hec jg main, during the preseason, ive seen Mortal Reminder all of five times, and twice were on me. LDR is seven times, three times on me, once as Hec too.

His ultimate lasts 12 seconds.

MR lasts 5 seconds.

I auto'd him several times

Over half the duration he was GV, so how in the fuck are you sitting here telling me that "we failed to keep the mark on him" when I'm literally telling you he was in combat and managed to recover almost all his HP despite the mark. GV doesn't nullifying healing, it only reduces it and they nerfed that aspect.

And are you going to pretend the fact that Sadism doesn't give him a massive "fuck you" speed boost anyways, should he choose to regen instead?

We are telling you that you failed to keep the mark on him because that is the only plausible explanation for the situation you described other than that there was a source of healing that you hadn't yet mentioned.  Mundo simply could not heal that much if you did keep the GW on him.  Over 12 seconds he could have healed a maximum of 52% Max HP if he had GW applied the whole time.

The math shows that there must be something off with either your description of the events or the code of the game (or the math but I can and have checked that).  We are not saying that Mundo is balanced; if your description of the events is accurate then there must be a bug in the game related to Mundo's healing or GW.

They can nerf Hec if they feel the need to, but their approach is not adequate in my opinion. 

Removing his "ignore collision" passive and binding it to his E Active will just make him super clunky in lane to play. I'd rather they nerf his damage output a bit than remove his entire theme of "Ghost Horse".
I do D:

I think you need better champion picking powers. All of your favorites get reworked or nerfed.

/s

> Removing his "ignore collision" passive and binding it to his E Active will just make him super clunky in lane to play.

That's the idea.  Lane Hecarim has historically been extremely toxic, much like Zac and Alistar.

I dislike that they can't nerf Hecarim meaningfully without nerfing his quality of life, but Hecarim can not be balanced as a top laner with his kit the way it is, just like Janna couldn't be balanced as an AP mid, and Alistar couldn't be balanced as a jungler.

I don't get it. His Q is inferior to old Darius Q. His E is a generic speed-up. His W is a generic heal. I see nothing imbalanced in it. Tryndamere literally has *everything in his kit* better for top lane, is 100x more aggravating to play against since he literally cheats death, yet you're saying top lane Hecarim, is extremely toxic. Wow. I'm at a loss for words.
Can't they just have his Q deal less damage if it hits several targets?
